programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank battles with City Council speaker Regina Thomas over protests against police brutality; Jamie and his nephew, Joe Hill, try to locate a missing Danny and Baez; Eddie helps an abrasive woman find her father's body.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jamie combine forces to convict a notorious drug lord; Erin nervously awaits the governor's selection for the new district attorney; Frank and his grandson face a difficult decision as they navigate their new and complicated family ties.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank struggles after Joe Hill's lineage as a Reagan is revealed; Erin and Anthony receive gift-wrapped evidence; Danny's opposition to authority clashes with Jamie's adherence to the rules, as both brothers work to solve a murder.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin is conflicted by the weight of her authority in the sentencing of a man who is guilty of vehicular homicide; Danny and Baez pursue a rideshare rapist; Jamie and Eddie team up to aid a fellow officer when his partner is shot on the job.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Eddie and her partner, Officer Rachel Witten, are heralded for their bravery for stopping an active shooter, until a civilian comes forward to accuse them of faking the incident as part of a government conspiracy.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank deals with a police captain who's losing his grip over his precinct; Danny faces backlash after a tough call he made in the field; Erin weighs the consequences of a dangerous criminal's release under new bail laws.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: A man rents the truck for an incredible $1,000 and an all-expenses-paid vacation at a swank resort.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will are unwitting accomplices in a bookmaking operation when a bookie hides his day's collections in their truck.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will and Sonny go to Alabama to visit Jack, a shrimper pal of Sonny's. But Jack isn't shrimping: he thinks he has found a sunken ship with a million-dollar fleet payroll on it.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: After Sonny performs at a trucker's convention stag night, a conniving talent agent convinces him that he has the makings of a country music superstar.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride's daughter is attacked on campus, the team finds a surveillance van loaded with pictures of the special agent's every move.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates when a Navy lieutenant is murdered during a traditional funeral procession in the French Quarter honoring the recently deceased.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant dies during a secret visit to a general's hotel, agent Pride and the team are asked to break protocol for the investigation.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While visiting her family's restaurant in the French Quarter, a Navy culinary specialist is the target of an explosion; in D.C., Brody tracks a lead in the Gen. Leak case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS teams with Homeland Security when the murder of a Navy master diver is discovered to be linked to the chatter concerning a foreign attack on the city.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Burgess realizes that her sister, Nicole, never made it home after a night out with friends, the members of the intelligence team make finding Nicole their top priority.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The murder weapon in the killing of a teenage boy is linked to a case Voight worked on 17 years ago; the victim's father wants Area Central Homicide to take the case.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence investigates armed bank robberies, which point to some surprising suspects; Lindsay is forced to make a decision in the heat of the moment.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A vigilante posts a video online of a man, previously locked up for statutory rape, being beaten and burned alive; Lindsay encounters some personal and professional problems.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Lindsay's mother, Bunny, becomes a murder suspect when her boyfriend is shot; high school students overdose on drugs; Lindsay finds herself up against the review board.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A young bystander is shot during a difficult operation; Chief Lugo reviews the shootout and Halstead becomes a key player in the outcome.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A patrol officer becomes a suspect when a van explodes during a Chicago street festival; Burgess, who helped train the officer, is desperate to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation into a murder of an illegal immigrant is hampered by the perception of police among the city's immigrant population.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation into a drug-related homicide is hampered by the neighborhood's no-snitch culture; Upton is asked about Ruzek's rough altercation with a suspect.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A meth lab bust uncovers a scam in which children adopted from foreign countries are abandoned, then sold online; Atwater struggles with decisions about moving his siblings to a safer environment.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A family is killed, and the team searches for a drug dealer with a likely connection; Voight asks Vice Sgt. Sean McGrady for help.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Halstead goes under cover to stop an ex-military kidnapping crew from killing an innocent child.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When one of Voight's friends is found passed out in his hotel room with a dead Ukranian girl, Intelligence discovers the murder is connected to a sting and Burgess' boyfriend.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The death of Judge Tommy Wells' daughter puts Intelligence on the track of a pill mill spreading into the suburbs of Chicago and the doctor enabling it; Voight discovers who's been leaking information from the 21st.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Halstead puts his career on the line to help solve a case with ties to his new girlfriend; Voight finally discovers the mole in his unit.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While on a case Nick is shot by a drug dealer, luckily a woman happens upon & takes him to her house to tend to his wounds. While he has survived the bullet wound, it turns out his savior is actually insane & imprisons! She plans on keeping him captive, so she has someone to love her forever! As time passes Sylvie and Spider, worry & Nick's safety & try to find him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A rape victim hires Nick and Sylvie to track down the man who violated her, a serial rapist who marks all of his victims with a tattoo.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A man hires Nick to protect his daughter who's involved with a dangerous arms dealer. However, it turns out that she was sent undercover to get close to the guy by a group who wants to stop the arms dealer and his trade.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While on a date, Nick is drugged by an unknown person and is framed for a bank robbery and a double murder. Now it is a race against time to clear his name, before he is sent to jail!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Someone is trying to assassinate a club owner. Since he's a friend of Nick and Sylvie's, he asks the duo to check whether or not his biggest competitor has something to do with it.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Solids, liquids and gases are the three main states of matter. But where do things like cornstarch mud fit in? It seems like a liquid, but when you hit it - it turns solid.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Aerodynamics! What makes airplanes (or basketballs, or people) fly? It's air. As well as a bunch of other things that we learn when we try to make a giant paper airplane.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Raven is no bird brain. Its considered one of the smartest animals on the planet! The fox turtle can completely disappear inside its shell when threatened. The lion fish has become one of the most invasive and destructive species in the Atlantic Ocean!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The pufferfish; the hummingbird.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: The week from oceans to mountains we follow the paths of animal migrations. We start in Hawaii as Philippe joins a humpback whale research team to get up close and in the water with these majestic animals that swim thousands of miles each year to and from Alaska. Then it's into the rocky mountains to see how Jackson, Wyoming accommodates thousands of elk that migrate to this area each winter.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: See how we can save our planet. We start at the Karen Beasley Sea Turtle Rescue and Rehabilitation center in North Carolina as Philippe gets a tour of this incredible facility. We then head to the beach where dozens of sea turtles are released back into the wild. In the Pacific Ocean, Trilogy Excursions leads regular coral reef cleaning to preserve the ecosystems there.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a real estate agent whose body was found in the walls of one of his listings; Danny's mother visits with unexpected news.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.desc: The daughter of a macadamia nut tycoon is killed with a stiletto heel during Chin's high school reunion.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads the team to uncover a possible terrorist cell planning an attack on U.S. soil.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Catherine and McGarrett go to Afghanistan to help a young boy, whose family saved Catherine years earlier.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover is forced to steal $100 million when a nemesis kidnaps his daughter; Wo Fat goes back to Oahu after escaping from prison.

programme.desc: O'ahu goes on lockdown as the team looks for a terrorist who is using weaponized drones on civilians; McGarrett and Danno attend a review with a psychologist.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: All over the world, there are places and objects that are thought to be cursed; many people avoid these locations and things, believing they will bring harm, while others think that curses are nothing more than superstition and folklore.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Around the world, people have claimed to have seen bizarre creatures that can only be described as monsters or beasts.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: King Arthur, England's first pop culture superhero; his exploits inspired blockbuster movies and television series like "Middle Earth", "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "Star Wars"; the significant impact of Arthurian legend on Western culture.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout the world, there are ancient structures that defy explanation because even with today's technology they would be nearly impossible to duplicate.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Since 2017, the Navy has been releasing photos and videos of unidentified aerial phenomena, and ancient astronaut theorists suggest the images are nearly identical to accounts from centuries ago.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the ancient world, tales are told of fire-breathing dragons; though fearsome, they have been worshipped as the bringers of great knowledge and credited as the founders of civilization.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at some of the structures visited all over the world that could provide undeniable evidence of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: "Ancient Aliens" has examined the oldest and most mysterious rock art on Earth up close, and Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the incredible hieroglyphs, petroglyphs, and geoglyphs that he believes tell a worldwide story of alien visitation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The team investigates the world's oldest and most incredible relics up close; Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most mysterious artifacts from all over the globe, those he believes provide undeniable proof of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In Ireland, the notion of the fairy folk dates back thousands of years and originates with stories of powerful shining beings who came down from the sky; exploring if these tales have been inspired by ancient alien visitation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the nearly 2,000-year-old text called "The Zohar," there is a curious passage that describes hidden realms beneath the surface of the Earth, each of which is said to be populated by both human and non-human intelligences.

programme.desc: "Ancient Aliens" has examined the oldest and most mysterious rock art on Earth up close, and Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the incredible hieroglyphs, petroglyphs, and geoglyphs that he believes tell a worldwide story of alien visitation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The team investigates the world's oldest and most incredible relics up close; Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most mysterious artifacts from all over the globe, those he believes provide undeniable proof of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In Ireland, the notion of the fairy folk dates back thousands of years and originates with stories of powerful shining beings who came down from the sky; exploring if these tales have been inspired by ancient alien visitation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the nearly 2,000-year-old text called "The Zohar," there is a curious passage that describes hidden realms beneath the surface of the Earth, each of which is said to be populated by both human and non-human intelligences.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's the only unsolved air piracy case in history; in 1971, a man hijacks a Northwest Orient Airlines flight, demanding four parachutes and $200,000; he jumps out of the plane with the money and is never seen again.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Awe-inspiring and mysterious, the pyramids of Egypt are significant wonders of the ancient world; more than 4,000 years old, they are celebrated architectural marvels, but no one fully understands how they were built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A look at what could cause mysterious vanishings in the Bermuda Triangle, a 500,000 square mile area of the Atlantic where ships, planes and unsuspecting travelers have been lost without a trace.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous stories from the Bible; for thousands of years the tale of Noah's Ark is shared, but little is known about what happened to the ark.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Thousands of people swear they've encountered the legendary North American creature Bigfoot, but Bigfoot has never been officially identified; as evidence continues to mount, and photos are scrutinized, the mystery endures.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The gruesome murder of a young beauty goes unsolved for decades; there's a long line of suspects, each more mysterious than the next.

programme.title: Kingpin
programme.desc: In the 1970s in Colombia, a petty thief rises to become the most powerful criminal in history, unleashing a bloody reign of terror to create the first global drug cartel and become the first billionaire kingpin of the 20th century.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Juan García Ábrego's cocaine smuggling empire grows to an estimated $10 billion; despite his nickname, The Doll, García Ábrego has a reputation for brutality and is suspected of ordering dozens of killings.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Anibal Mustelier was considered amongst the most dangerous criminals of the Cocaine Cowboy days in Miami; suspected of multiple assassinations and the mastermind behind elaborate bank and jewelry heists.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Omar Portee, aka OG Mack, watches street gangs operate on the West Coast, then brings the knowledge back home to the Bronx, N.Y.; at Rikers Island, Portee creates the United Blood Nation and watches it spread throughout the East Coast.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Tim and Barbara Pasa meet and marry quickly; two children and 18 years later, they seem happy until emergency services rush to their home; a life has been lost in what looks like a tragic accident caused by a lit candle, but a darker truth emerges.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: After lawyer Chiquita Tate marries construction worker Greg Harris, the couple become the envy for their glamorous lifestyle; after a violent murder, Chiquita's criminal clientele is suspected, but the killer might be closer to home.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Christine and Jason Harris fall in love, get married and have two children; Christina makes a shocking discovery followed by a deadly plot that gets blown wide open when a mother's frozen breast milk cracks the case.

programme.title: Sleeping With a Killer
programme.desc: The story of 24-year-old Alice Ruggles, who was murdered by her ex after a terrifying campaign of stalking and harassment following the end of their brief relationship.

programme.title: Sleeping With a Killer
programme.desc: A jealous man takes matters into his own hands when his ex-girlfriend moves on from their relationship, killing her and dismembering her body.

programme.title: Sleeping With a Killer
programme.desc: When James Barry breaks up with his girlfriend Melanie Eam in 2016, she retaliates by snatching his life away.

programme.desc: A violent confrontation over an alleged inappropriate comment leads to one man's death in Tampa, Florida.

programme.desc: A high ranking government official authorizes the arrests and subsequent deportations of over 1,400 Jews to Nazi concentration camps where most of them perish. programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Jeff and Jonny can't decide which supertruck is best, or even what the definition of supertruck is; they debate whether it's about how it looks, sounds or drives, horsepower/torque, whether it can be electric, and whether it can even do truck things.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: No EV maker has yet cracked the market for hot hatches; they're small, nimble, fun - all things EVs aren't; the guys turn to gasoline to figure out the best hot hatch on the market today: the Toyota GR Corolla or the Honda Civic Type R.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is pushing his engineering chops to the limit by building a monster trike that would look right at home on the set of a "Mad Max" movie.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda get a '65 Chevy II Nova for a steal, but as the team digs in, rat nests and rust are the least of their worries; the build requires a complete overhaul and has them thinking they bit off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Fitment issues in the engine bay leave the entire shop scratching their heads; Joe has big plans for the '65 Nova, but a small space to work with.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer wants to surprise his wife with major upgrades to her '68 Corvette convertible, but working with the fiberglass body soon brings on headaches that threaten both the car and the shop to crack under the pressure.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The clock is ticking to complete a 1968 Corvette convertible, but messy fiberglass repairs uncover major collision damage; and if that wasn't enough, the customer also wants an all-white interior, which isn't a good fit for such a dirty job.

programme.title: Through the Storm
programme.desc: Follows the 2023 season of the Red Lake Nation (Ojibwe) high school football team. Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1996 matchup between the Yankees and the Braves. Rookie of the Year Derek Jeter led New York from a 2-0 deficit to win four straight and bring the World Series back to the Bronx for the first time in almost 20 years.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1997 matchup between the Marlins and the Indians. A back and forth series between Florida and Cleveland, the Marlins walked it off in the 11th inning of Game 7 to give the team its first World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Having set a modern-day record for most wins in the regular season, the Yankees faced the Padres and established themselves as one of the best teams to ever put on the Pinstripes.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series MVP Mariano Rivera leads the Yankees to the franchise's third championship in the last four seasons and 25th overall, sweeping the Braves in four games in a rematch of the 1996 Fall Classic.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: Sergeant Rutledge
programme.desc: At a U.S. Army fort in the Arizona Territory in 1881, an officer is murdered and his beautiful young daughter is beaten, raped and strangled. Army lawyer Tom Cantrell (Jeffrey Hunter) defends the accused, African-American sergeant Braxton Rutledge (Woody Strode), a soldier who had once been under his command. Under questioning by Cantrell and the prosecutor (Carleton Young), multiple witnesses piece together the truth of what happened at the fort that day.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: The Story of a horse and the boy who loved him! In this thrilling Western TV series a recent widower (Peter Graves) and owner of the Broken Wheel ranch takes in Joey, a young orphan boy. The ranch is also the home of a wild stallion named Fury, that none of the ranch hands can tameexcept young the boy! programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.desc: Brothers Andrew and James Widdas run the Rose and Crown in Edgworth, near Bolton. Their dream is to provide boutique on a budget, but they only have eight months of experience, and B&B veterans Alison and Lynda are quick to find fault.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe with new owners Martin and Hannah Weaver. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group stay at Sue's dog friendly Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth no one knows quite what to expect.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to East Linton in Scotland and the Crown and Kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The New Court Hotel in Usk, where manager Clare Davies is joined in the competition by the pub owner's mother, Fran Hancock. On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their dessert, but who will impress? Stephen Terry with `Bronze, Silver or Gold?', Richard Davies with passion fruit cream and gel with bitter chocolate sorbet or James Sommerin with raspberry and lemon cheesecake? `Great British Menu' veteran Angela Hartnett decides who goes through to the judges on Friday and who is going home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Wales. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West contenders Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw, plus newcomer Simon Hulstone, kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Paul with his `Breakfast of Champions'; Nathan with hogs pudding with seaweed, potato terrine and mushroom ketchup; or Simon Hulstone with track and field - beetroot and goats cheese?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish course, but which one but which one will prevail? Will it be Paul Ainsworth with monkfish `Two Showings'; Nathan Outlaw with mackerel, horseradish and oyster sauce; or Simon Hulstone with `The Swimming Pool'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes. Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Then and Now'; Nathan Outlaw with elderflower and lemon tart, with strawberry sorbet and meringues; or Simon Hulstone with `Closing Ceremony'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The 2012 competition enters its final week. The winners of the regional heats compete for a chance for their dish to be on the final banquet menu at a prestigious event hosted by Sir Steve Redgrave with a glittering guest list of British Olympians. Here, the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this year's `Great British Menu'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: rabbit with pea mousse, ham hock with pea puree and heather smoked macon with pickled beetroot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course for three of London and the South East's hottest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt Gillan is determined to make it to this year's banquet, but he faces fierce competition in the two newcomers.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund - go head to head with their fish courses. Lee is hoping his modern plate of mackerel and passion fruit will outclass Matt and Mark's more traditionally inspired salmon dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt is determined to bring home a 10 with his ambitious celebration of the billy goat but has he bitten off more than he can chew?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by Mary Gwynn, author of the official WI centenary cookbook. Together they'll decide which chef goes through to represent the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course and as the chefs arrive they discover there's added competition following the London and South East region's shock result. The judges are joined by D-Day veteran George Batts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better. The judges are joined by Ken Sturdy who landed on Sword Beach on D-Day and who helped judge the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the halfway point in finals week and those chefs who have yet to get a dish onto the shortlist are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by Baroness Trumpington who worked as a cypher clerk at Bletchley Park from 1941 to 1946.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs to get their dish in contention for the final banquet and those who've failed to finish in the top three so far are going all out. Joining the judges is Celia Sandys, Winston Churchill's granddaughter.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After months of nurturing the plants in his garden, Monty reaps a harvest of a different kind when he investigates how productive his bees have been at making honey. Joe Swift visits the world famous Chatsworth House in Derbyshire to explore the history of its monumental 19th-century rock garden and to see how a more contemporary version compliments the original design.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There is a visitor at Longmeadow this week, when Rachel de Thame lends Monty a hand as he refreshes his dry garden with plants that will thrive in tricky growing conditions. Monty also visits a national collection of vines.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A catch-up with three sisters in Dorset to discover how their collapsed greenhouse turned into an opportunity to transform part of their garden. Plus, Monty plants garlic and onions, transplants foxgloves, and prepares his strawberry bed for winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's apple harvest time, and Monty shares tips on what to do with windfalls before planting a container to give a colourful boost for winter insects. Plus, Adam Frost visits a designer who has overcome extreme weather and difficult terrain.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: The Break
programme.desc: The Turkey Professor, Joe Hoehn, swaps his Browning Maxus turkey gun for an X-Bolt and slug gun as he hits the deer woods in Missouri and Illinois.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Hunting means many different things to those of us who do it. It’s a way to strengthen relationships, gain deeper connections to the land, provide food for our families and increase our appreciation for elk and other wildlife.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Daily farm activities during the busy season. Main topic VS 1, pullingcedars. Cody Robison's Whitetail Hunt using 10 point and using VS 1

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: The King of Cedar Key, Capt. Jimbo Keith ⎮ Episode #867On Today’s Podcast, I have a very special guest, He is known as the King of Cedar Key, Captain Jimbo Keith. Nearly 40 years ago, Jimbo’s father, Jimbo Sr, founded Saltwater Assassin, the premiere charter fishing company in Cedar Key. Working at the same company, Jimbo heads an airboat through the shallow waters of Northern Florida. Join us in learning about the beautiful Old Florida, and what it is like captaining 270 days out of the year. Jimbo’s Links:Saltwater Assassin - https://fishcedarkey.comFacebook - https://www.facebook.com/FishCedarKey/Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/captjimbokeith/YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA54Q_2S0kUZyv2EtlducmAMy Links:https://linktr.ee/TomRowlandPodcastLink to Book Club on: Tomrowlandpodcast.com

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With bow camp starting off strong at the Dirty Bird, Randy is feeling good about the rest of the week. Until Cody decides to head into town and places a small wager with a stranger.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the best week of the year and the Raven crew is getting together for a fun filled week at Rifle Camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The rut is in full swing at the Raven. Cody goes after a buck he has had several years of history with while Randy is staring at one.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From then to now. The Raven Farm has been an ongoing project and we want to catch you up from the very beginning to what it is now and what we have to look forward to the future. This farm is going to be a mecca for giant whitetails.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When overnight temps go low and the tides go lower, it forces Redfish to move. Justin & Travis break out a new micro skiff to see how low they can go to ambush shifting redfish on the flats.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s playtime for Travis & Justin when offshore guide Josh Sauls shares a secret honey hole and his fishing ancestry. Then luck shines when the guys find another sweet spot on the way back.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: The irresistibly serene gulf waters off Panama City Beach lure Justin into taking Capt. Ed Zyak out to see what's biting. It quickly turns into a study session and a lesson. Patience + perseverance = success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has spent a lifetime buying, selling and rigging boats to fit his angling needs. Learn what you need to ask yourself before shopping for the perfect boat and what to look for at the dealership.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Travis review clips from previous trips and guess the fish being targeted by what's shown on screen. We learn why they use a variety of tackle and how angling experience leads to insight.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Following the Bluefin action of early summer, Ali and Rush head back to San Diego to see what August has to offer. With the tuna settling in and a kelp fishery in full swing, Ali considers this to be the "peak" time to target bluefin tuna, mahi, and yellowtail. With each year before bringing a new twist to the fishery, this season follows suit with a "puddle" of Mahi that leaves the guys scratching their heads.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Appointed Outdoors
programme.desc: Bucky flies home from New Orleans and helping people from the storm for opening day of Maryland deer season. And it’s a good thing he did.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Shane Mahoney has dedicated his entire life to the conservation of wildlife. His Hope is for human kind to come to value the landscapes and the wildlife that lives on those landscapes. His Hope is that we come to value the wild products that we are still able to harvest from the land and the habitats that we have protected - before we forget generationally how important and beautiful it is.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: After the first cold front of the year, JP targets shallow largemouth bass using a swim jig.

programme.desc: Daniel Andrews of Captains for Clean Water discusses the state of the Everglades.

programme.desc: Tom & Rich are targeting bonefish but are pleasantly surprised by an eager school of redfish.

programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss chases after giant Jack Crevalle on Lake Pontchartrain, Louisiana.

programme.desc: The season is winding down and coming to a close on the Mississippi River! The river is high, and the bucks are on their feet!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Lake and Jordan start the season off chasing long spurred gobblers in South Florida at Black Beards Ranch.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: If something can go wrong, it will go wrong! Team Primos is in Iowa and Missouri, and a no named hunter…(Lake Pickle) is having a laughably hard time putting down a gobbler!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Brad & crew hop north of the border into Nebraska and finish up a fantastic Midwest turkey trip!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s non-stop and up-close big bull action as Team Primos kicks off the 2020 season with an early September hunt in New Mexico. The entire team is in camp and on-point to chase some big bugling bulls. Brad Farris drew the long straw this fall and waste no time heading up the mountain with Will Primos dropping back and firing up the Hyper lip double, Hoochie mama and the bullet bugle elk calls.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: The Team is back and ready for action at Kudzu Bluff, looking to make the most of an early December rut. Turns out, running late to your stand and staying mobile can actually payoff. Question is, how big will the payoff be? Watch Brad and Jimmy as they figure it out.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt struggles with freezing Nebraska temperatures on a whitetail rut hunt in the Sandhills.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Seasoned bowhunter Bob Robb remains humble as he faces a reality that no amount of practicing can ever fully eliminate.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Mark Kayser enters the South Dakota frozen tundra after a handful of mature rutting whitetails.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt heads to Nebraska to talk to the experts at Hornady ammunition and get their take and what the best calibers are for whitetail deer hunting.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Editor-n-Chief Dan Schmidt unravels the social structure of the whitetail doe community. Meanwhile, already tagged out on a big buck in Texas, outdoor writer Brad Fenson turns his sights onto mature does.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Mark Kayser in in Montana as the whitetail rut is dying down, thankfully for him, his tag is good for whitetail or mule deer.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger find themselves in a hot bottom bite out of Key West.

programme.title: Into The Blue
