programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: The Break
programme.desc: The Turkey Professor, Joe Hoehn, swaps his Browning Maxus turkey gun for an X-Bolt and slug gun as he hits the deer woods in Missouri and Illinois.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Hunting means many different things to those of us who do it. It’s a way to strengthen relationships, gain deeper connections to the land, provide food for our families and increase our appreciation for elk and other wildlife.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Daily farm activities during the busy season. Main topic VS 1, pullingcedars. Cody Robison's Whitetail Hunt using 10 point and using VS 1

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: The King of Cedar Key, Capt. Jimbo Keith ⎮ Episode #867On Today’s Podcast, I have a very special guest, He is known as the King of Cedar Key, Captain Jimbo Keith. Nearly 40 years ago, Jimbo’s father, Jimbo Sr, founded Saltwater Assassin, the premiere charter fishing company in Cedar Key. Working at the same company, Jimbo heads an airboat through the shallow waters of Northern Florida. Join us in learning about the beautiful Old Florida, and what it is like captaining 270 days out of the year. Jimbo’s Links:Saltwater Assassin - https://fishcedarkey.comFacebook - https://www.facebook.com/FishCedarKey/Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/captjimbokeith/YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA54Q_2S0kUZyv2EtlducmAMy Links:https://linktr.ee/TomRowlandPodcastLink to Book Club on: Tomrowlandpodcast.com

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With bow camp starting off strong at the Dirty Bird, Randy is feeling good about the rest of the week. Until Cody decides to head into town and places a small wager with a stranger.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the best week of the year and the Raven crew is getting together for a fun filled week at Rifle Camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The rut is in full swing at the Raven. Cody goes after a buck he has had several years of history with while Randy is staring at one.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From then to now. The Raven Farm has been an ongoing project and we want to catch you up from the very beginning to what it is now and what we have to look forward to the future. This farm is going to be a mecca for giant whitetails.

With the tuna settling in and a kelp fishery in full swing, Ali considers this to be the "peak" time to target bluefin tuna, mahi, and yellowtail. With each year before bringing a new twist to the fishery, this season follows suit with a "puddle" of Mahi that leaves the guys scratching their heads.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Appointed Outdoors
programme.desc: Bucky flies home from New Orleans and helping people from the storm for opening day of Maryland deer season. And it’s a good thing he did.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Shane Mahoney has dedicated his entire life to the conservation of wildlife. His Hope is for human kind to come to value the landscapes and the wildlife that lives on those landscapes. His Hope is that we come to value the wild products that we are still able to harvest from the land and the habitats that we have protected - before we forget generationally how important and beautiful it is.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s non-stop and up-close big bull action as Team Primos kicks off the 2020 season with an early September hunt in New Mexico. Brad Farris drew the long straw this fall and waste no time heading up the mountain with Will Primos dropping back and firing up the Hyper lip double, Hoochie mama and the bullet bugle elk calls.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: The Team is back and ready for action at Kudzu Bluff, looking to make the most of an early December rut. Turns out, running late to your stand and staying mobile can actually payoff. Question is, how big will the payoff be? Watch Brad and Jimmy as they figure it out.

programme.desc: Dan Schmidt struggles with freezing Nebraska temperatures on a whitetail rut hunt in the Sandhills.

programme.desc: Seasoned bowhunter Bob Robb remains humble as he faces a reality that no amount of practicing can ever fully eliminate.

programme.desc: Mark Kayser enters the South Dakota frozen tundra after a handful of mature rutting whitetails.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.desc: When overnight temps go low and the tides go lower, it forces Redfish to move. Justin & Travis break out a new micro skiff to see how low they can go to ambush shifting redfish on the flats.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has spent a lifetime buying, selling and rigging boats to fit his angling needs. Learn what you need to ask yourself before shopping for the perfect boat and what to look for at the dealership.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Determining where fish species congregate starts at the bottom. Justin and Travis examine the expansion of artificial structure and live bottom fishing and learn there's much more to be discovered.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.desc: "George travels to Chicago to sample the legendary triple "cheezborger.""

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam heads to Amarillo, TX, to take on a 72-ounce steak dinner challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam heads to Memphis, TN, to take on a seven-and-a-half-pound burger.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam travels to Pittsburgh to take on six scorchingly hot wings.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam travels to Ohio to tackle a two-and-a-half-pound sandwich challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam travels to Austin, TX, for a near-impossible breakfast taco challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam visits the Windy City to take on three meat-laden sandwiches.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam returns to the city of his alma mater to tackle an 11-pound pizza.

programme.title: Man v. Food With Adam Richman
programme.desc: Adam goes head-to-head with a Beantown local over a 12-pound hamburger.

programme.title: Lion
programme.desc: A 5-year-old Indian is adopted by a couple in Australia; 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.

programme.title: Tucker: The Man and His Dream
programme.desc: An inventor and lifelong car enthusiast strives to design a revolutionary vehicle for the masses, but faces fierce opposition from the auto industry.

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: The story of Beach Boys singer/song writer Brian Wilson and his struggles with mental illness.

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: The inspirational real-life story of a detective and her domestic partner follows their battle with the legal system that denied them equal rights.

programme.title: Fanboys
programme.desc: Star Wars fans try to steal a copy of "The Phantom Menace," so their terminally ill friend can see it.

programme.title: Meatballs
programme.desc: In this classic comedy, camp counselor Tripper guides a collection of lovable campers and libidinous staff through the pleasures of a coed summer,

programme.title: The Young and Prodigious T.S. Spivet
programme.desc: A ten-year-old leaves his family's ranch and travels across the country to receive an award at the Smithsonian

programme.title: The Spy Next Door
programme.desc: A man asked to baby-sit his neighbor's children winds up having to fight off secret agents after one of the kids inadvertently downloads a secret code.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: A female pirate and her companion race against their rivals to find a hidden island that contains a fabulous treasure.

programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Without any special powers or training, high school nerd Dave decides to take his love of comic books to a new level and become a vigilante superhero.

programme.title: Guns Akimbo
programme.desc: A guy relies on his newly acquired gladiator skills to save his ex-girlfriend from kidnappers.

programme.title: 24 Hours to Live
programme.desc: A former special-ops soldier, turned mercenary, is given one last shot at redemption on a non-stop,danger-packed mission, on which his life depends.

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: After a failed global-warming experiment, a post-apocalyptic Ice Age has killed off nearly all life on Earth.

programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Without any special powers or training, high school nerd Dave decides to take his love of comic books to a new level and become a vigilante superhero.

programme.title: Guns Akimbo
programme.desc: A guy relies on his newly acquired gladiator skills to save his ex-girlfriend from kidnappers.

programme.title: 24 Hours to Live
programme.desc: A former special-ops soldier, turned mercenary, is given one last shot at redemption on a non-stop,danger-packed mission, on which his life depends.

programme.title: Flight 7500
programme.desc: It’s terror in the aisles of Flight 7500 to Tokyo from Los Angeles when it’s seized by an evil force after the jet hits stomach dropping turbulence.

programme.title: The Eye
programme.desc: A classical violinist receives a cornea transplant and finally begins to see clearly, but soon starts experiencing supernatural visions of death.

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: An American nurse living in Tokyo finds herself exposed to a mysterious supernatural curse that keeps a person in a state of powerful rage.

programme.title: Winchester
programme.desc: Fearing the ghosts of the victims of her husband’s firearms, the cursed widow Winchester constructs a 7-story byzantine mansion to appease them.

programme.title: Drive Angry
programme.desc: A tormented man with a hellish past comes to avenge his daughter and save her baby from a satanic cult, while hunted by his own mysterious pursuer.

programme.title: Daybreakers
programme.desc: A plague has turned most of the world’s population into vampires. A man cured of vampirism believes he has the secret to saving humanity.

programme.title: The Crazies
programme.desc: A small town becomes a massive, hysteria-filled crime scene when, one by one, neighbors, friends, and family are possessed by homicidal behaviors.

programme.title: Solomon Kane
programme.desc: Captain Solomon Kane (James Purefoy) is a brutally efficient 16th Century killing machine.

programme.title: Joe Versus the Volcano
programme.desc: A corporate drone receives life-altering news, and agrees to a tycoon’s odd request to travel halfway around the world and jump into a volcano.

programme.title: 8 Seconds
programme.desc: Dreams and perseverance lead to an Oklahoma boy's meteoric rise as a champion bull rider in this film about the life of pro rodeo cowboy Lane Frost.

programme.title: True Stories
programme.desc: David Byrne whimsically pays homage to the mythical small Texas town of Virgil.

programme.title: Jackie Chan's First Strike
programme.desc: Caught between the CIA, the Mafia, and Russian intelligence, a keen yet bumbling cop finds himself at the center of a plot to steal a nuclear warhead.

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Six young urbanites with budding careers and restless hearts share their dreams, their music, and the common courtyard between their apartments.

programme.title: Elvis: That's The Way It Is (Special Edition)
programme.desc: This feature-length concert film crosses the footlights to reveal the King of Rock and Roll’s triumphant 1970 return to the stage in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Harlem Globetrotters: The Team That Changed the World
programme.desc: This entertaining sports documentary explores the Harlem Globetrotters' social and cultural impact.

programme.title: ABBA The Movie
programme.desc: A young D.J. on his first assignment follows ABBA during a sold-out, screaming, wild tour across Australia.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: In this unofficial sequel to Purple Rain, the Kid and Morris are rival nightclub owners tangled in a power struggle over the Minneapolis music scene.

programme.title: Who's That Girl?
programme.desc: A woman sets off on a madcap quest to find the person guilty of the crime for which she served the time.

programme.title: Oh, God!
programme.desc: George Burns stars as God when He comes to Earth, business card in hand.

programme.title: Oh, God! Book II
programme.desc: God returns to Earth and recruits a student to help him devise an advertising campaign to spread his message.

programme.title: Oh, God! You Devil
programme.desc: A musician sells his soul to the Devil, as God and the Devil battle for the musician's soul.

programme.title: One Crazy Summer
programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Two sanitation workers and diehard wrestling fans watch their idol suffer a career-ending defeat and travel to Atlanta to mastermind his comeback.

programme.title: Night Shift
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck financial planner meets a fast-talking loser at the New York City morgue.

programme.title: Palmetto
programme.desc: A parolee becomes entangled in an ill-fated kidnapping scheme when he returns home from prison.

programme.title: Alex & Emma
programme.desc: A novelist with a serious case of writer's block and an even worse gambling problem needs to finish his novel to pay off his gaming debts.

programme.title: ¡Mucha Lucha!: The Return of El Maléfico
programme.desc: When the dark force of El Maléfico threatens the world of Lucha Libre, the three Mascaritas must fight.

programme.title: 8 Seconds
programme.desc: Dreams and perseverance lead to an Oklahoma boy's meteoric rise as a champion bull rider in this film about the life of pro rodeo cowboy Lane Frost.

programme.title: American Flyers
programme.desc: A shared tragedy between two brothers brings them closer together, giving them the strength they need to finish in a bike race across the Rockies.

programme.title: Cannonball Run II
programme.desc: A wealthy man offers a fortune to the first person able to travel from California to Connecticut by car.

programme.title: Harlem Globetrotters: The Team That Changed the World
programme.desc: This entertaining sports documentary explores the Harlem Globetrotters' social and cultural impact.

programme.title: Oxford Blues
programme.desc: A Vegas hustler falls in love at first sight with a British aristocrat and follows her back to England.

programme.title: Barcelona
programme.desc: Two American cousins - Ted, a salesman, and Fred, a soldier - meet in Barcelona in this witty romantic comedy.

programme.title: Me and Orson Welles
programme.desc: New York, 1937. Richard (Zac Efron) lucks into a starring role in Orson Welles's production of Julius Caesar.

programme.title: The International
programme.desc: Interpol agent Louis Salinger and New York Assistant District Attorney Eleanor Whitman track a high-stakes international money trail.

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: A brutal LAPD cop, who is a domineering single dad and neighborhood hawk, makes the lives of a new couple a living hell when they move in next door.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wife’s divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Solo
programme.desc: A powerful government killing machine with the appearance of a man carries out a series of missions. Soon, this being starts to grow a conscience.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: S.I.S.
programme.desc: An elite police squad hunts down the worst criminals in Los Angeles, but they may have met their match when they track a notorious, volatile killer.

programme.title: Fugitive Nights: Danger in the Desert
programme.desc: An ordinary surveillance operation for a Palm Springs P.I. and a soon-to-be retired cop escalates into a fugitive investigation with a deadly end.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: Armored guards are supposed to ensure no money gets stolen but when a team of guards’ plans for a heist go wrong, they begin to betray each other.

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind (Director's Cut)
programme.desc: After an encounter with UFOs, a line worker feels undeniably drawn to an area in the wilderness, where something spectacular is about to happen.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: Taking 5
programme.desc: Two nerdy teens fan-out to the extreme and plot to kidnap the world’s most famous boy band to make them play at their school and make them popular.

programme.title: Buster & Chauncey's Silent Night
programme.desc: Two 19th-century Austrian mice evade a voracious cat, aid a kidnapped orphan, foil thieves and help create a holiday classic.

programme.title: North
programme.desc: After a judge allows him to sever ties to his work-obsessed parents, a boy embarks on an international quest for the quintessential set of parents.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: The open seas are ripe for adventure and romance as a man does his best to win the America’s Cup for the U.S. in a string of yacht races.

programme.title: Blonde Ambition
programme.desc: After small-town Katie follows her fiance to New York and catches him with another woman, she rebounds with a dream job that isn't what it appears.

programme.title: Whatever It Takes
programme.desc: A romantic teen comedy about the lengths that people will go to land their ideal partner—only to discover that reality doesn't live up to the fantasy.

programme.title: Calendar Girl
programme.desc: It's 1962 and three friends just out of high school journey to Hollywood determined to meet the object of their shared obsession: Marilyn Monroe.

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: A sudden storm leaves a family shipwrecked on an uncharted island inhabited by other stranded settlers and a tribe of natives with strange powers.

programme.title: The China Syndrome
programme.desc: A news reporter (Jane Fonda) and her cameraman (Michael Douglas) are unintentional witnesses to a SCRAM incident, an emergency core shutdown procedure at a nuclear power plant in California. The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: Convicted
programme.desc: During a barroom brawl, Joe Hufford (Glenn Ford) accidentally kills the son of a powerful, prominent man. The district attorney, George Knowland (Broderick Crawford), wins a manslaughter conviction, despite having doubts about the defendant's guilt. Joe is sent to prison, and George, who eventually becomes the warden there, hopes to get him released. But Joe gets so immersed in the culture and codes of the jailhouse that he finds it difficult to believe in his own innocence.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: Baby the Rain Must Fall
programme.desc: After his release from prison, an aspiring country singer tries to go straight, but his dream of a singing career puts this plan in danger.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Sandra Dee became a model for countless teenagers in the late 1950's when she played Gidget, a sad-faced youngster who doesn't quite measure up to the chesty, bikinied girls on the beach. Her mom's reassurances come true when two surfers start paying Gidget some attention.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: California Conquest
programme.desc: A Spanish swashbuckler (Cornel Wilde) and a gunsmith's daughter (Teresa Wright) oppose a Russian plot to annex California.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Outlaws Is Coming
programme.desc: Moe, Larry and Curly Joe (Adam West) bring their head-knocking, eye-gouging antics to the Wild West. When reporter Kenneth Cabot (Nancy Kovack) heads to Wyoming to stop the slaughter of buffaloes, he brings the stooges with him. There, they trade barbs with Billy the Kid, Jesse James and Wild Bill Hickock, while Cabot gets elected town sheriff. But they'll need some help from Annie Oakley (Mort Mills) when it comes to foiling the criminal plans of a land-hungry frontier villain.

programme.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Old West outlaw Bill Doolin (Randolph Scott) marries a deacon's wife, but his gang will not leave him alone.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: The Walking Hills
programme.desc: During a poker game in a Mexican bar, a group of men discover the location of a lost wagon train -- and its cargo of gold. To prevent one man from cheating the rest, it's decided that they will find it together. Among them are horse breeder Jim Carey (Randolph Scott) and rodeo rider Shep Wilson (William Bishop) ; like their cohorts in the treasure hunt, they share a tangled history -- Chris Jackson (Ella Raines), Shep's current sweetheart, is Jim's old flame. Greed and suspicion soon break out.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: The Last Rebel
programme.desc: Two Confederates (Joe Namath, Jack Elam) save a man's (Woody Strode) life and cause trouble in 1865 Missouri.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: King of the Wild Horses
programme.desc: A mustang stallion runs swiftly to the rescue when the boy who befriended him is endangered.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: The Return of Wild Bill
programme.desc: Wild Bill Saunders comes home to help his father deal with troublesome ranchers.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Ozzy Osbourne: Black Sabbath Frontman

programme.title: KISS Frontmen: Gene Simmons & Paul Stanley

programme.title: Poison: Breaking The Band
programme.desc: In the 1980s, metal band Poison were united in their determination to become rock stars. Through hard work and relentless promotion, they did indeed take the world by storm. Their off-stage excess and partying, along with their female following, was legendary. Festering jealousies and power struggles, worsening addictions, gladiatorial backstage fist fights and ultimately burnout from constant touring and partying were amongst the trials they faced.. So which of these ended up poisoning Poison?

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank stumble upon a labyrinth of curious finds during a freestyle pick; the guys tour a vintage car company where the owner's entire collection of retro relics is for sale; the boys' crate of European treasure has landed in the states.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find an elephant, an alligator and a life-size sculpture of Elvis in rural Vermont; a treasure trove of folk art finds and rare military memorabilia; Danielle gets encouraging news from an appraiser.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A costume shop in upstate New York; a stash of Art Deco cigarette machines; an appraiser is awestruck by a recent find; Mike's coveted 1911 Harley is finally ready for its first test drive.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A former firefighter gives the guys unprecedented access to his jam-packed barns and sheds; a glittering collection of oddities and memorabilia; the first glimpse of the new store addition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction returns to the town of Mesquite, and so does Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe. The Rangers go chasing after vengeance, and their aim is true on a find that brings out a hidden talent.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer joins as a bidder and stirs things up with Ricky and Bubba. Jenny and Mary disagree on the value of their finds, and one makes a surprising profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action takes place in Garland, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba challenge "The King of East Texas Flea Markets." Jenny and Mary, searching for armchairs and armoires, discover an armory.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas, the big city of fat wallets and fast action. Jenny is on the lookout for industrial material for a custom job. Mary flouts the law while going for a dream locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: In the city of DeSoto, Texas, the big-money buyers are on the lookout for antiques. Ricky and Bubba are menaced by a new face from across the pond.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action takes place in the Houston suburb of Conroe, Texas, where the buyers are met by an old adversary.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: In search of old furniture and new territory, the buyers travel east to the border town of Texarkana. Slick Vic goes silent and stealthy to acquire a unit with action figures. Jenny the Dazzler may find diamonds in the rough.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction in Killeen, Texas, where Bubba Smith went to high school, stirs up teenage memories for the Rangers and the other buyers. Victor overcomes a bad hair day to uncover some Civil War collectibles.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action gets tense in Arlington, Texas. Jenny must once again face down her nemeses Ricky and Bubba to acquire her dream locker. Moe and Mary discover rhythm and melody.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to the classic Texas town of Fort Worth, where Victor seeks an ally in his bidding battle against Ricky and Bubba, who have their eyes on a coveted plasma cutter. Jenny finds an antique worthy of scientific examination.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction takes place in the small East Texas town of Hallsville -- and it seems like nearly everyone shows up to compete with our buyers. Vic meets a local beauty queen, while Ricky and Bubba fight the crowds.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction takes place in Lancaster, Texas -- a spot on Bonnie and Clyde's 1934 robbery spree -- and the buyers also hope to make out like bandits. Rick and Bubba seek to stock up for a huge furniture sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers hit the old Chisholm Trail city of Fort Worth. Jenny identifies Ricky and Bubba as obstacles to her success and aims to beat them at their own game. Victor finds women's accessories and offends the appraiser.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers converge in the town of DeSoto, where a stranger on a motorcycle raises both prices and eyebrows. With only four lockers up for grabs, Ricky and Bubba aim for a sweep.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas, the big city of fat wallets and fast action. Jenny is on the lookout for industrial material for a custom job. Mary flouts the law while going for a dream locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: In the city of DeSoto, Texas, the big-money buyers are on the lookout for antiques. Ricky and Bubba are menaced by a new face from across the pond.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action takes place in the Houston suburb of Conroe, Texas, where the buyers are met by an old adversary.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: In search of old furniture and new territory, the buyers travel east to the border town of Texarkana. Slick Vic goes silent and stealthy to acquire a unit with action figures. Jenny the Dazzler may find diamonds in the rough.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction in Killeen, Texas, where Bubba Smith went to high school, stirs up teenage memories for the Rangers and the other buyers. Victor overcomes a bad hair day to uncover some Civil War collectibles.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action gets tense in Arlington, Texas. Jenny must once again face down her nemeses Ricky and Bubba to acquire her dream locker. Moe and Mary discover rhythm and melody.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to the classic Texas town of Fort Worth, where Victor seeks an ally in his bidding battle against Ricky and Bubba, who have their eyes on a coveted plasma cutter. Jenny finds an antique worthy of scientific examination.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction takes place in the small East Texas town of Hallsville -- and it seems like nearly everyone shows up to compete with our buyers. Vic meets a local beauty queen, while Ricky and Bubba fight the crowds.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction takes place in Lancaster, Texas -- a spot on Bonnie and Clyde's 1934 robbery spree -- and the buyers also hope to make out like bandits. Rick and Bubba seek to stock up for a huge furniture sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers hit the old Chisholm Trail city of Fort Worth. Jenny identifies Ricky and Bubba as obstacles to her success and aims to beat them at their own game. Victor finds women's accessories and offends the appraiser.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers converge in the town of DeSoto, where a stranger on a motorcycle raises both prices and eyebrows. With only four lockers up for grabs, Ricky and Bubba aim for a sweep.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Burbank, Calif., Barry and Jarrod lose a packed locker to a bold new buyer; Herb and Mike hope to crush a contemptible competitor.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders travel to San Jacinto, Calif.; Darrell makes a musical purchase; Brandi and Jarrod must team up with Barry in order to turn a profit; Nabila attempts to expand her territory.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit El Monte, Calif.; the Harris Brothers go into stealth mode; Jarrod and Brandi feel charitable; Darrell hopes a big pole will vault him to the top.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell defends his turf when the buyers descend upon Costa Mesa, Calif.; Ivy Calvin comes across a unique tool; Jarrod and Brandi seek store stock.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Orange, Calif.; Ivy Calvin finds collectibles in the garbage; Jarrod and Brandi hope to earn a profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit Laguna Niguel, Calif.; Jarrod and Brandi discover some toys; Ivy Calvin tries to climb out of a hole; Barry tries his luck on a safe.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is visited by wrestling legend "Rowdy" Roddy Piper; Rene and Casey score a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars; Darrell uncovers cat-related items.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers roll into Compton, Calif.; Jarrod gets a new nickname; Mike purchases a locker that Herb doesn't want; Barry is reunited with his old friend Kenny.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders look to strike it big in Long Beach, Calif.; Jarrod shows up just in time to judge Brandi's buy; Darrell and Brandon's purchase could brew up a tidy profit.

programme.desc: The bidders look for bargains in Inglewood, Calif.; a confident Barry rides in on his motorcycle; Jarrod and Brandi hope to trick the new buyers; Ivy spends big for a unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes to score another major find as the bidders converge in Stanton, Calif.; Mark's custom-made man purse is filled with cash; Nabila's locker is fit for a dummy.

programme.desc: The bidders look for bargains in Rancho Cucamonga, Calif.; Jarrod and Brandi obtain a small set of tools; Barry arrives late to the festivities; Mark hopes a large printer will earn him a large profit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank stumble upon a labyrinth of curious finds during a freestyle pick; the guys tour a vintage car company where the owner's entire collection of retro relics is for sale; the boys' crate of European treasure has landed in the states.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find an elephant, an alligator and a life-size sculpture of Elvis in rural Vermont; a treasure trove of folk art finds and rare military memorabilia; Danielle gets encouraging news from an appraiser.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A costume shop in upstate New York; a stash of Art Deco cigarette machines; an appraiser is awestruck by a recent find; Mike's coveted 1911 Harley is finally ready for its first test drive.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A former firefighter gives the guys unprecedented access to his jam-packed barns and sheds; a glittering collection of oddities and memorabilia; the first glimpse of the new store addition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fiancé Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a "color run" to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery, but things take a turn when it Kay is asked to hand over her secret recipes.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy and Jase's son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career, his parents begin to question some of his choices.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and his brothers spend too much time frog hunting, their wives challenge them to a "frogging" competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University where they will drop off John Luke and Mary Kate for their first year of college. Along the way, they stop in Nashville to visit Willie's friend Colt Ford.

programme.desc: The Robertson family throws a party for Willie & Korie's 25th anniversary, but things take a dramatic turn when Willie and Korie reveal a big secret. Meanwhile, when Jase blames Uncle Si for getting him a parking ticket.

programme.desc: When Willie asks a local chainsaw artist to make him a statue, he gets a big surprise when it's revealed that the statue is of an unlikely subject -- Willie himself. Meanwhile, Jep and Jessica attempt to help Kay with her hoarding.
